thread.title: Man Utd news: Replacing Michael Carrick big problem for Jose Mourinho, says Paul Scholes | Metro News
thread.title_full: Man Utd news: Replacing Michael Carrick big problem for Jose Mourinho, says Paul Scholes | Metro News

author: George Bellshaw For Metro.Co.Uk
title: Man Utd news: Replacing Michael Carrick big problem for Jose Mourinho, says Paul Scholes | Metro News
text:
George Bellshaw for Metro.co.uk Wednesday 22 Feb 2017 10:31 am Mourinho will have to replace Carrick (Picture: Getty) 
Paul Scholes believes replacing Michael Carrick will be Jose Mourinho’s biggest long-term problem at Manchester United. Keep smiling! Mourinho of all people melts hearts with touching message to Ranieri 
The club legend played alongside the former Tottenham Hotspur midfielder at Old Trafford and believes Carrick’s influence on his team-mates is extremely tough to replace. 
Scholes believes Carrick’s ability to make those around him feel comfortable by his intelligent positioning – a quality he feels is tough to replicate. 
And the former England international thinks Mourinho will have a tough job on his hands replacing the 35-year-old when he does decide to hang up his boots. 
‘It was a big help for me when I was playing,’ he told Goal. Carrick will be tough to replace (Picture: AFP/Getty) 
‘I can only talk from experience from what you know and I knew playing with Michael that I had somebody next to me who was reliable. He was always in the right place. 
‘If you wandered off somewhere it didn’t matter because Michael would be there behind you backing you up.
